summary:
I received an MSc in Applied Mathematics in 1991, an MSc in Geoinformatics in 2000 and the PhD in Geoinformatics from Wageningen University with the Mathematical and Statistical Methods group and Earth Observation Science department from the International Institute for Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC), The Netherlands, in 2006.

I am an analytical and focused R&D professional with extensive experience in identifying issues, developing coherent solutions, and moving complex projects forward. I have worked in research in academia and the high-tech industry. I am results-driven, promoting clear and sound thought processes to support arguments and comprehensible lines of reasoning, with strong ability to structure and optimise projects. Proven success in strengthening communication base with researchers, cross-functional teams, students, and other subject matter experts to deliver all necessary scientific information within specific time duration. Proven expertise in: Scientific Research & Development, Mathematical Modelling, Data & Statistical analysis, Spatial data analysis & visualisation, Uncertainty quantification, Algorithm design and efficiency, Machine Learning techniques, Sensor Networks, Complex issues resolution, Research proposals & Bids development, Cross-functional collaboration.

profile_positions.description: Principal analytics engineer leading the algorithms research for prostate cancer detection from ultrasound medical imaging. Collaborating with university researchers and domain experts in signal processing, machine learning, optimisation, computer aided diagnosis, and clinical trials. Supervise PhD and MSc students in the development of methods and algorithm prototyping.
profile_positions.title: Principal Researcher

profile_positions.description: Research and Development algorithms engineer for the Environmental Sensors business line. Co-ordinated with multi-skilled characterisation, product, and application engineers to lead project operations and prepare bids. Developed robust statistical methods and machine learning algorithms for the characterisation and calibration of air quality sensors, improved algorithms and sensor performance of air quality legacy products.
profile_positions.title: Senior Algorithm Developer

profile_positions.description:
Researcher for Mathematical modelling and Simulations (now Data Science) group and Earth Observation, Climate and Optical group. Collaborated with NPL scientists and academic and industrial partners driving and executing European research projects, and in the preparation of research proposals and bids. Formulated solutions for the harmonisation of long-term satellite sensor series for the development of fundamental climate data records, developed techniques for large-scale least squares optimization and Monte Carlo simulation for uncertainty evaluation in satellite data products, designed comprehensive and robust traceability chain for EO satellite and in-situ sensor measurements employing best metrology practises for uncertainty quantification.
Key projects: "Metrological methods" work-package in H2020 project FIDUCEO “Fidelity and Uncertainty in Climate Data Records from Earth Observation”; error budget in vicarious calibration of EO optical sensors in "Mathematical tools" task of FP7 project MetEOC-2 “Metrology for Earth Observation and Climate”; RadCalNet measurements for radiometry validation tasks in "Sentinel-2 Radiometry Validation" ESA SEOM (European Space Agency scientific exploitation of operational missions) project.
profile_positions.title: Higher Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Researcher at the Pervasive Systems group in the Computer Science department. Collaborated with a multi-disciplinary team of CS researchers and partners from industry and academia for the preparation of research proposals and execution of research projects as work-package or task leader. Supervised PhD and MSc students, organised scientific events, and performed reviews for scientific journals and conferences. Led the design and development of a suite of distributed protocols for routing and scheduling in wireless sensor networks, addressing scalability, robustness, dynamics, energy efficiency, and optimization in WSNs. Led research on object extraction from remote sensing images, analysis of temporal trends and quantification of uncertainty, and computing with uncertainty in pattern discovery from GPS trajectories. 
Key projects: work-package "Distributed Networking Protocols and Algorithms” in AgentschapNL PointOne project Free “True-Wireless Mesh Networks for Transport and Logistics”; task “Architecture of Wireless Communication Networks” in ITEA/ PointOne project “A Reconfigurable Surveillance System with Smart Sensors and Communication”.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Researcher in GIS-technology section. Collaborated with partners from industry, academia and public sector in European and national projects. Led and performed research on spatial data modelling and analysis, data structures and algorithms for multi-resolution and spatio-temporal data, and semantic matching. Published results in scientific articles and technical reports, presented findings in conferences and project meetings, performed reviews for journals and conferences, organised scientific events. Supervised MSc students, taught classes in spatial reasoning and uncertainty. 
Key projects: researcher for “Data Harmonization” and “Scenarios” work-packages in FP6-AEROSPACE project HUMBOLDT “Development of a Framework for Data Harmonisation and Service Integration”; lead researcher for “Prototype development” and “Improved prototypes” work-packages in AgentschapNL Bsik project MobiMaps “Usable and well-scaled mobile maps for consumers”; lead researcher for “Data Modelling” in Bsik project GDI4DM “Geospatial Data Infrastructure for Disaster Management”.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

company.name: International Institute of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC)

profile_positions.company: Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC) of the University of Twente
profile_positions.description:
Researcher in FP5-IST project REV!GIS “Uncertain Geographic Knowledge, Maintenance and Revision”, working with representation of and computing with uncertainty in spatial data. The PhD research resulted in data structures and algorithms for spatial data storage and analysis, and employed fuzzy logic and topology and metric spaces for the formal definitions, and computational geometry algorithms with a prototype system built on open source GIS software. I worked with case studies that modelled the spatial dynamics of coastal erosion, air quality and vegetation drought. 
Supervised geoinformatics and computer science master students, and taught courses on spatial and relational databases.
profile_positions.title: PhD researcher

profile_positions.description: Database design and management, SQL querying, web application development in PHP and MySQL
profile_positions.title: Database Programmer

profile_positions.description: Technical lead of GIS and Remote Sensing group at the Geographic Studies Center, overseeing data management and spatial analysis for national and EU projects. Contributed to PHARE CORINE Land Cover project in computer-aided interpretation of satellite images and auxiliary data for country wide mapping of Corine land-cover classes, working with ArcInfo and AML scripting.
profile_positions.title: GIS specialist

profile_positions.company: Akademia e Shkencave e Shqipërisë/Academy of Sciences of Albania
profile_positions.description: Researcher at the Institute of Informatics and Applied Mathematics (INIMA), working with algorithms, databases and dynamic web for national and European research projects. Contributed to FP4 INCO-COPERNICUS Hannibal project with web and database solutions for e-marketing in support to small businesses. Taught courses of database design and use to mid-career professionals.
profile_positions.title: Researcher
